verses.kjv: And after the uproar was ceased, Paul called unto him the disciples, and embraced them, and departed for to go into Macedonia.
verses.ct: Once the riot had died down, Paul gathered the disciples together, hugged them goodbye, and left for Macedonia.

verses.kjv: And when he had gone over those parts, and had given them much exhortation, he came into Greece,
verses.ct: He traveled through that region, spending a lot of time encouraging the believers, and then arrived in Greece.

verses.kjv: And there abode three months. And when the Jews laid wait for him, as he was about to sail into Syria, he purposed to return through Macedonia.
verses.ct: He stayed there for 3 months. But when the Jews plotted against him just as he was about to set sail for Syria, he decided to go back through Macedonia instead.

verses.kjv: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timotheus; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.
verses.ct: Several people traveled with him into Asia: Sopater from Berea, Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica, Gaius from Derbe, Timothy, and Tychicus and Trophimus from Asia.

verses.kjv: These going before tarried for us at Troas.
verses.ct: These men went on ahead and waited for us in Troas.

verses.kjv: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread, and came unto them to Troas in five days; where we abode seven days.
verses.ct: We sailed from Philippi after the Festival of Unleavened Bread and joined them in Troas 5 days later. We stayed there for 7 days.

verses.kjv: And upon the first day of the week, when the disciples came together to break bread, Paul preached unto them, ready to depart on the morrow; and continued his speech until midnight.
verses.ct: On Sunday, when the believers gathered to share a meal together, Paul spoke to them. Since he planned to leave the next day, he kept talking until midnight.

verses.kjv: And there were many lights in the upper chamber, where they were gathered together.
verses.ct: There were many lamps burning in the upstairs room where we were meeting.

verses.kjv: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus, being fallen into a deep sleep: and as Paul was long preaching, he sunk down with sleep, and fell down from the third loft, and was taken up dead.
verses.ct: A young man named Eutychus was sitting in the window and fell into a deep sleep as Paul kept talking. Overcome by sleep, he fell from the 3rd floor and was picked up dead.

verses.kjv: And Paul went down, and fell on him, and embracing him said, Trouble not yourselves; for his life is in him.
verses.ct: Paul went downstairs, threw himself on the young man, and put his arms around him. "Don't be alarmed," he said. "He's alive!"

verses.kjv: When he therefore was come up again, and had broken bread, and eaten, and talked a long while, even till break of day, so he departed.
verses.ct: Then Paul went back upstairs, shared the meal, and ate. He continued talking with them until dawn, and then he left.

verses.kjv: And they brought the young man alive, and were not a little comforted.
verses.ct: The people took the young man home alive and were incredibly relieved.

verses.kjv: And we went before to ship, and sailed unto Assos, there intending to take in Paul: for so had he appointed, minding himself to go afoot.
verses.ct: We went ahead to the ship and sailed for Assos, where we planned to pick up Paul. He had arranged it this way because he intended to travel there on foot.

verses.kjv: And when he met with us at Assos, we took him in, and came to Mitylene.
verses.ct: When he met us at Assos, we took him aboard and sailed to Mitylene.

verses.kjv: And we sailed thence, and came the next day over against Chios; and the next day we arrived at Samos, and tarried at Trogyllium; and the next day we came to Miletus.
verses.ct: From there we sailed on, and the following day we passed near Chios. The day after that we reached Samos, stopped at Trogyllium, and the next day arrived at Miletus.

verses.kjv: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus, because he would not spend the time in Asia: for he hasted, if it were possible for him, to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost.
verses.ct: Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus to avoid spending time in Asia, because he was hurrying to reach Jerusalem by the day of Pentecost if possible.

verses.kjv: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called the elders of the church.
verses.ct: From Miletus, he sent a message to Ephesus and asked the elders of the church to come to him.

verses.kjv: And when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye know, from the first day that I came into Asia, after what manner I have been with you at all seasons,
verses.ct: When they arrived, he told them, "You know how I lived among you the entire time from the first day I set foot in Asia.

verses.kjv: Serving the LORD with all humility of mind, and with many tears, and temptations, which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews:
verses.ct: I served the Lord with complete humility, with many tears, and through the difficulties that came my way because of the plots of the Jews.

verses.kjv: And how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you, but have shewed you, and have taught you publickly, and from house to house,
verses.ct: You know that I never held back anything that would help you. I taught you both in public and in your homes.

verses.kjv: Testifying both to the Jews, and also to the Greeks, repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: I urged both Jews and Greeks to turn to God in repentance and to put their faith in our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: And now, behold, I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem, not knowing the things that shall befall me there:
verses.ct: Now look — I am going to Jerusalem, compelled by the Spirit, without knowing what will happen to me there.

verses.kjv: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions abide me.
verses.ct: The only thing I do know is that in every city, the Holy Spirit warns me that prison and suffering are waiting for me.

verses.kjv: But none of these things move me, neither count I my life dear unto myself, so that I might finish my course with joy, and the ministry, which I have received of the Lord Jesus, to testify the gospel of the grace of God.
verses.ct: But none of that concerns me. I don't consider my life worth anything to me, as long as I can complete the mission and the work that the Lord Jesus gave me — to declare the good news of God's grace.

verses.kjv: And now, behold, I know that ye all, among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God, shall see my face no more.
verses.ct: Now pay attention — I know that none of you among whom I have traveled proclaiming the kingdom of God will ever see me again.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I take you to record this day, that I am pure from the blood of all men.
verses.ct: That is why I declare to you today that I am not responsible for anyone's destruction.

verses.kjv: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God.
verses.ct: Because I never hesitated to share with you the complete plan of God.

verses.kjv: Take heed therefore unto yourselves, and to all the flock, over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers, to feed the church of God, which he hath purchased with his own blood.
verses.ct: Guard yourselves and the entire flock that the Holy Spirit has placed in your care as overseers. Shepherd the church of God, which he purchased with his own blood.

verses.kjv: For I know this, that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock.
verses.ct: I know that after I leave, vicious wolves will come in among you and will not spare the flock.

verses.kjv: Also of your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away disciples after them.
verses.ct: Even from your own group, people will rise up and twist the truth in order to lure disciples into following them.

verses.kjv: Therefore watch, and remember, that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears.
verses.ct: So stay alert! Remember that for 3 years I never stopped warning each of you, night and day, with tears.

verses.kjv: And now, brethren, I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified.
verses.ct: Now, brothers, I place you in God's hands and in the care of his message of grace, which has the power to strengthen you and give you an inheritance among all those who are set apart for him.

verses.kjv: I have coveted no man’s silver, or gold, or apparel.
verses.ct: I never wanted anyone's silver, gold, or clothing.

verses.kjv: Yea, ye yourselves know, that these hands have ministered unto my necessities, and to them that were with me.
verses.ct: You know for yourselves that these hands of mine provided for my own needs and for the needs of those who were with me.

verses.kjv: I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.
verses.ct: In everything I did, I showed you that by working hard like this, we should help the weak. Remember the words of the Lord Jesus himself: 'It is more of a blessing to give than to receive.'"

verses.kjv: And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down, and prayed with them all.
verses.ct: After saying this, Paul knelt down and prayed with all of them.

verses.kjv: And they all wept sore, and fell on Paul’s neck, and kissed him,
verses.ct: They all cried deeply, threw their arms around Paul, and kissed him.

verses.kjv: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him unto the ship.
verses.ct: What grieved them most was his statement that they would never see him again. Then they walked with him to the ship.
